description: Salvage excavations in the 80s revealed a site covering the west bank of the river which has been identified as a shrine. A rectangular ditched enclosure with an internal circular foundation trench and a central pit. No sure dating but late Roman coins were found.
bibliography: Jones, A. “Romano-Celtic Shrine and Settlements and Little Paxton Quarry, Diddington, Cambridgeshire.” The Proceedings of the Cambridge Antiquarian Society 90 (2001): 5–27.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Little Paxton Quarry Shrine (Cambridgeshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
